result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Neal Resheed French

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Neal Resheed French appeared by video.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Neal Resheed French.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Order to show cause hearing held. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Neal Resheed French in court.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. State requests a State v Lee hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Neal Resheed French in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SH, AS, or AR.

Defendant Neal Resheed French in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Neal Resheed French in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Neal Resheed French appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
